result.execSummary:
All charges against Scott Michael Andrews in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott Michael Andrews is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Michael Andrews

records.addlTxt:
3:02 PM Defendant Scott Michael Andrews in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Scott Michael Andrews.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State asks that Count 2 in 2020CF432 be terminated off the DJOC. For Count 2 in 20CF432, 120 days jail imposed and stayed for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation include pay court costs only, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and serve 9 days with credit for 9 days-time served. Concurrent probation and concurrent jail time. In 22CF66, 22TR573 and 22TR574 are to be dismissed. Attorney Hoffman in agreement. Court terminates DJOC for Count 2 in 20CF432.

Court imposes for Count 2 in 20CF432, 120 days jail imposed and stayed for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation include pay court costs only, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and serve 9 days with credit for 9 days-time served. Concurrent probation and concurrent jail time. In 22CF66, 22TR573 and 22TR574 are dismissed.

9:39 AM Defendant Scott Michael Andrews not in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Scott Michael Andrews.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Hoffman has no information. State requests warrant and forfeiture. Court orders warrant and forfeiture.
Default on citations in the amount of citations with 60 days to pay.

Court recalls case at 9:49AM. Defendant appears. Court quashes warrant, rescinds forfeiture, reopen citations. Defendant had transportation issues. Hoffman indicates would like to accept offer.  Asks for plea date. Court sets dates.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:46 AM Defendant Scott Michael Andrews in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Scott Michael Andrews.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF66, 22TR573, and 22TR574. State indicates that an offer has been extended, asks for another status. Attorney Hoffman is in agreement, asks for status within 2-3 weeks.
Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:43 AM Defendant Scott Michael Andrews in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Scott Michael Andrews.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates discussions had, defers to Hoffman. Hoffman indicates close to resolution, asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:33 AM Defendant Scott Michael Andrews in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Scott Michael Andrews.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Asks for a status in 30-45 days. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.pdf
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:14 AM Defendant Scott Michael Andrews in court and not in-custody with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State calls witness  Officer Matt Swanson, Police Officer for the City of Superior. State-direct examination of witness. On March 21, 2022, in the City of Superior, Douglas County Wisconsin is where the incident occurred. Witness identifies Defendant. Court notes defendant has been identified. Attorney Hoffman cross examines witness. State objects to question, relevance. Court allows the question. State offers Exhibit 1 - Bail Bond form from case number 20CF432 - no use or possession of controlled substances or drug related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Atty Hoffman has no objection to its admitance. Exhibit is received. 
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of bail conditions. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

01:42 PM Defendant Scott Michael Andrews in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman who makse special appearance.  Defendant Scott Michael Andrews in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott Michael Andrews appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant's address confirmed.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Court accepts plea of not guilty on misdemeanor counts.   States request on bail: $750 cash bail with conditions of   No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant is currently on probation and does have a felony deferred prosecution. State gives prior criminal history. 
Atty Hoffman indicates defendant did live at the current address for a year, but prior to that he was in Douglas county for many years. Defendant was employed as of last month. Defendant does have a serious medical condition. Defendant does not have any money he can post at this time. 
Court Orders $1000 cash bail with conditions of No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Defendant does qualify for Public Defender.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Cash bond set; 2020CF000432; Andrews, Scott Michael_1170815_6.pdf
